title: Citywide Summary
text:
This website includes summary statistics from MKEPropertyOwnership.com. Property data was last updated on Feb 26, 2024. We last checked for new updates on Mar 08, 2024. You can view the underlying source code and download raw data from this Github repository.
Currently, we identify 48,956 rental properties containing 157,292 housing units. We identify 21,555 total ownership networks of which 15,603 (72%) own just a single property. Of those networks which own multiple properties, 3,373 include multiple distinct owner names.

networks by size
Most landlord networks are small. In fact, 72% of networks own just a single parcel. Another 18% own 2 or 3 parcels. Together, these two categories own 50% of all the rental parcels in the city. Collectively, ownership networks with at least 26 parcels own 20% of rental parcels, despite constituting just 0.6% of owner networks.





While most rental parcels are owned by smaller owner networks, most rental units are owned by larger networks, as shown in the graph below.
Only 3.2% of networks own more than 25 units, but these networks collectively own 59% of the cityâ€™s rental inventory.
